articles.title: Astronomers are already unscrambling the warped galaxies seen by JWST
articles.description: The first deep-field image from the James Webb Space Telescope is full of distant galaxies with their light warped by gravity, and astronomers are already using them to hunt dark matter
articles.content:
By Leah Crane
The SMACS 0723 galaxy cluster
The firehose of James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) data has opened, and astronomers have begun to drink from it. Just days after the observatorys first fu… [+364 chars]

articles.title: Antarctic bacteria reveal an evolutionary limit to dealing with heat
articles.description: Some bacteria living in the Southern Ocean can only adapt to temperatures about 2°C above what they usually live in, and other organisms could face similar limits adapting to higher temperatures
articles.content:
By James Dinneen
Southern Ocean and Antarctic islands near the Antarctic Peninsula
Copyright (c) 2014 Tarpan/Shutterstock

articles.title: How to cut your risk of catching the BA.4 and BA.5 covid subvariants
articles.description: The latest omicron subvariants are more transmissible and better able to evade immunity from vaccines and past infections, but there are still steps you can take to reduce your risk of infection
articles.content:
By Grace Wade
Passengers wear masks on the New York City subway
Robert Nickelsberg/Getty Images

articles.title: Robot made of sticky tape and metal powder could crawl on your organs
articles.description: Tiny robots made of metallic powder stuck to plastic tape and controlled by magnetic fields could one day crawl inside internal organs and repair injuries
articles.content:
By Matthew Sparkes
Robots made from sticky tape and dust can morph into various shapes under the direction of a magnetic field. They may one day be able to crawl into computers to fix broken circuit… [+2375 chars]

articles.title: Prehistoric dart-throwing atlatl weapon even more deadly than thought
articles.description: Tests of the prehistoric atlatl on a bison carcass recorded using a high-speed camera show the weapon could be very effective at bringing down large animals by puncturing their vital organs
articles.content:
By Jeremy Hsu
Donny Dust about to test an atlatl

Tests of a prehistoric dart-throwing weapon has shown it is even more effective than previously thought. The atlatl weapon can puncture … [+399 chars]

articles.title: UK prepares for health emergency with 50 per cent chance of 40°C heat
articles.description: The Met Office says there is now a 20 per cent chance of temperatures hitting the milestone of 40°C for the first time, and a 40 per cent chance of a new record
articles.content:
By Adam Vaughan
The UK Met Office is warning of extreme heat expected on Monday and Tuesday

articles.title: What we know so far about how covid-19 affects sperm
articles.description: Evidence suggests covid-19 infections can lower sperm counts for months, and that the virus can occasionally be found in semen and may even directly bind to sperm cells
articles.content:

articles.title: When did humans start making art and were Neanderthals artists too?
articles.description: On a visit to see ancient cave art in Spain, Michael Marshall explores why it's so hard to calculate the age of early human artworks and whether other hominins might also have created art.
